TopicTitle: What kind of Hardware do you use to run KSP

Articles.Content:
Intel Core i7-4771 @4.5 GHz

GTX 780

8 Gig RAM @ 1600 MHz

'nuff said

no lag whatsoever

Best 1600$ of my life

In KSP, if you want more parts with less lag, the only thing you want is more speed. If you can go faster with less threads, do it. With KSP, you CPU is never clocked fast enough. 4.5GHz is fine though (lag starts at 900 or 1000 parts, and most people would say itsstill very fine.)

I have a couple of i7 machines for KSP (OK and video if I have to), a 4770k and a 950. One with 32Gb and the other with 24Gb Both with 900MB/sec+ drives (Want to load quick? get fast drives... fast scene changes? fast drives...) one GTX 570 and one GTX 670 4GB (Could run KSP just on the graphics card)

"AMD Phenom II 965BE (showing its vintage, i'll probably replace it with one of the 8-core FX models when I get some money in the bank again)"

The Phenom BE's were designed with overclocking in mind. If you haven't yet overclocked your 965BE then you are not getting what you paid for. For example my 955BE I've bumped from 3.4 to 3.6ghz with stocking cooling. I plan to get an after market cooler (that will work on my next CPU too) and push that to 4.0ghz. Just moving from 3.4->3.6 made a huge improvement to KSP and other games. It is also very easy to do mild overclocks.
